Amora Jamison Hotel
8.7 Excellent
Based on 858 reviews

Hotel is located close to everything. It is on the fringe of the CBD. Only 5 to 10 minute walk to Rocks, Darling harbour and circle quay We were booked into a club level room entitling you to canopies and drinks from 5:30 to 7:30pm.

Quality of bites was excellent and menu changes daily. We also had access to breakfast on club level but opted for larger and more diverse offerings in 1st floor restaurant. We found ingredients, especially seasonally fruits to be excellent! Hotel does have indoor swimming pool but is on the smallish side Staff was capable, engaging and quite helpful. Learned best way to get to the airport from hotel is by train. We did have a top floor view over the harbour but a number of rooms are more obstructed so please be sure to inquire about the view. All and all, one of the best experiences we've had in hotels for quite some time. Would not hesitate to strongly recommend!

Show more
steven , United States
Shangri-la Hotel
8.7 Excellent
Based on 1499 reviews

Get a room with a view of the Opera House, especially during the Vivid Festival! On the down side, the wonderful view from the bar on level 36 is spoiled by lack of access.

The table layout is poor, and people book the space for functions, leaving it inaccessible for hotel guests. I had stayed here previously, so asked at check-in if I could reserve a table along the north facing window side, and was told it wasn't necessary, just show up close to opening time. The bar opens at 17.00, and I was there at 16.50, and there were three couples ahead of me waiting. With the tables already reserved, and four people ahead of me, I missed out. The entire north-east corner was reserved for a function, so that remained empty, and so the view was essentially quarantined. It could be managed so much more efficiently with better skills and communication.

Show more
robert , Australia
Radisson Blu Hotel Sydney
8.9 Excellent
Based on 472 reviews

We loved our stay here! The location is very convenient as it is just a few minutes from Circular Quay, George Street (shopping area), Train and etc.

The staff is also very kind and helpful. My sisters and I were thirsty one time and their bell captain gave us 3 free water bottles. The lady that cleaned our room is also very sweet as she fixed my sister's brushes that she left on the floor when we were in a hurry. She also left these cute little notes after :) We also love that they have free wifi for each room although it gets slow sometimes at 11-12mn. As for the food, we weren't able to try but we went to the plaza/eating area across it everyday. They also have a wide range of food there although they close very early. As for our room, we booked 2 rooms that will fit 3 people each. I recommend you get the room with 2 separate beds as I saw that it is much bigger combined than just 1 whole bed. My sisters and I got the 1 bed good thing we are just medium sized (5"2, 50kg) so we were able to fit quite nicely on the bed. Also, we got the 8th floor and we didn't have any issue with the noise outside since it's very quiet in CBD and there's no train that would make so much noise. As for our whole stay it was perfect except for our departure as the Maxi Taxi we called didn't arrive. Luckily we found a van that agreed to drive us to the airport. I recommend you call concierge at least the night before and ask for a maxi taxi 30min - 1hr to arrive before you actually want the taxi specially during rush hour as it's the CBD. Tip 1: Buy your water at Coles or Wellworth as it closes at around 12MN anyway. It's just $0.07 per liter! We bought ours at the nearby convenience store for the first few days and we regret buying it for $5.50 each liter! Tip 2: Exchange your money in Chinatown as that is where my dad got better rates. Near the hotel it's $100USD=$116AUD while in Chinatown it's $100USD=$135AUD as of Nov 3, 2015.

Show more
Lorainne , Philippines
Rydges World Square
8 Very good
Based on 1295 reviews

A nice and clean hotel with modern interior. The family room was not very big for 4 person but we managed.

The bathroom is quite spacious and spotless, with good shower. Not very much toiletries provided but the essentials were there. The best thing about the hotel is the location, very easy to find great food especially asian food (which was very convenient to us asians) the best chinese/korean/thai restaurant in the city was just a view minutes walk away..plus the capitol theater was just a block away which made it possible for us to get the rush tickets to Aladdin show (major bonus!) Very close to paddy's market, hyde park (where I jogged every morning), darling harbour, qvb and easy access to train/bus stasion. The front office staff was very friendly, gave us guidance on where to go and what to do 👍 The only glitch was on the last night we found sand on one of the bed sheets under the blanket (no explanation how?) but the staff immediately change the sheets after we report.

Show more
Mutya , Indonesia
Metro Hotel Marlow Sydney Central
7.5 Very good
Based on 3070 reviews

I stayed in this hotel with my daughter and my eighty-year-old mother for 4 days in Sydney in January.

Upon the first day arrival, we were trapped in the dated lift. It is understandable as we knew it is an outdated hotel from the online description. We had an elderly with us and she has high blood pressure. She had trouble breathing and she was feeling dizzy as it was Summer in Australia and the ventilation in the lift stopped working. God knows what would happen to my mother! What is unacceptable is that the staffs of the hotel refused to call the firefighters literally next to the hotel, instead, they called the technicians from the lift company who could not promise when they would be arriving. We demanded the reason why the refused to call the firefighters and their answer was that it was not a case of emergency and it would cost them a large sum of money to call the firefighters. Eventually, we were stuck in the lift suffocating for more than half an hour. I don't know if anybody would see this, but if you are looking for a safe and pleasant stay in Sydney, stay away from this hotel. As far as I can tell, this hotel is not planning to renovate itself in the foreseeable future as they reopened the lift in question as soon as we were released from the lift. My mother was shaken by this incident and her blood pressure went up to 160 and remained so for a long time while resting in the hotel room. I do not know what gave the staffs the impression that this was not a case of emergency and I doubt that they have any professional medical training. This was absolutely outrageous. If I could, I would not even have given it 1 star.

Show more
Wai , Hong Kong
Hyatt Regency Sydney
8.2 Excellent
Based on 659 reviews

We stayed here years ago and it has completely changed. You can no longer drive in to get off sussex st anymore, we had to pull over be instructed quickly where to go then try to pull accross 3 lanes of traffic into the parking station.

The entrance is no longer roomy and grand, it is cramped and busy (not sure if this is temporary during renovation) service is polite but no longer the feeling of going above and beyond, seeing we had a toddler with us it would have been nice to be asked if there was anything we needed extra for our room (eg we had to call for more towels ect once we got to our room and had to share a single bed with my daughter as they are not flexible with changing room configuration) we did notify them it would be 2 adults and one child. The biggest change is the access to darling harbour, you used to be able to walk down some stairs and across the road, now you have to walk all the way around and over the bridge which doesnt sound that bad but if you have a pram its not as convenient and direct as it was. Also it used to have an amazing buffet breakfast now I would just say it is good. All in all it is not a bad hotel I would just no longer pay the big price tag to stay there as it is not as good as it used to be. I hope the renovations deliver a better outcome in the future and this is just temporary.

Show more
Candice , Australia
Travelodge Hotel Sydney
7.5 Very good
Based on 3298 reviews

Stayed in a triple bedded room for 3 nights, the room was not cleaned properly, rubbish was still left on the floor, beds not made, just simply throw back blanket over the mattress with tissue paper still left on the beds.

Bath wash, shampoo etc not replaced accordingly. Need to keep request for replenishment.. The housekeeping cleaner that cleaned our room seem to give us an impression that she is not interest in doing a good cleaning job at all and is just trying to get it done as soon as possible.. . even the replacement tissue box was placed over the tissue holder with the empty tissue box still in the holder... really wonder whats the rush.... Not worth the money , could get a better service hotel with the price paid..

Show more
Keng , Malaysia
Swissotel Sydney
8.6 Excellent
Based on 1274 reviews

Absolutely wonderful experience. Rooms are clean and well serviced. Reception was friendly and very easy check in and check out process.

Our view was great from our room and we were a short walk away from Darling Harbour. We didn't try the bar or the restaurants but they looked amazing! Only gripe was that there is a Nespresso machine in the room but not enough milk nor anything to steam milk etc. - made for a difficult coffee making experience. I was doing a shot of the espresso then boiling water and a couple of the UHT milk packets. Otherwise, everything was wonderful and the valet parking service was great to utilise as it was my first time driving in Sydney so great to not have to worry about parking. Would definitely stay here again.

Show more
Hannah , Australia
Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
8.5 Excellent
Based on 219 reviews

Perfect place to stay to explore Sydney. Very near Market City, Paddy's Market, China Town, Darling Harbour and Downtown Sydney.

A lot of walking but lots to see while walking. Place and neighbourhood is safe even when walking at night. That's all we did. We walked to the Queen Victoria building in downtown Sydney from here. Hotel is newly renovated. Rooms had a safe, Iron and ironing board, small refrigerator, kettle and cups and glasses. We did not use the restaurant for breakfast so cant comment on that. Avoid Room 118 it is directly above the entrance. Vans come to pick up tourist in the morning and you can hear the noise. If you had a loud neighbour on the floor, you can hear them talking right through the walls as well. Price is good as compared to other hotels of same type. Cleaners have to vacuum carpet better so wear slippers always. Front Desk Staff is good in check in and check out, but needs more training on customer service. We always had to greet them first whenever we came back. Otherwise it was a pleasant stay.

Show more
William , Canada
Hilton Sydney
8.6 Excellent
Based on 1221 reviews

well.. I visited there last sunday, everything was well except for front desk's staff member's attitude.

an asian staff( she seems like..chinese, wearing black glasses around between 8pm-9pm on sunday) asked me some questions about personal details for matching my booking information with their computer system. However, Her attitude was quite a bit cold and did not have much face expressions, without smile. Well, of course, It is very personal, but I think the hilton hotel is a international hotel reprensented for their reputation. compared to other hotel staff member's attitude, she was not acceptable for international hotel service. the next day, front desk member, she seemed like a white lady, also quite a same as the asian lady as well. If your hotel wants to get an excellent grade for your industry, I think you should train your staffs as international standard service. compared to hotels located in asian as Korea, japan. services was very horrible.

Show more
ahrum , South Korea
Grace Hotel
8.5 Excellent
Based on 1123 reviews

My wife & I stayed here for one Tuesday night in March. The hotel has great architectural characteristics from a bygone era.

The hotel though is is excellent condition and room amenities are very good. Great king size bed. The room A/C was very hard (ie impossible) to adjust as evidenced by the very worn temperature control buttons, so I don't think that we were the first to have a problem. In hindsight I should have called reception but at 1.00am I thought not. Car parking is easy access around the block at $55.00 self-park, directly below the hotel. The buffet breakfast was ample and very good, typical hotel fare. There is a pizza/bar place adjoining the hotel and an "Irish" pub, but these don't appear to stay open late, so not the best option there. There is a hotel serving drinks till 11.30am on the opposite corner. We usually don't stay out late, but we had been to a concert at the Opera House and felt like a night cap. Apart from the room A/C we enjoyed our stay.

Show more
Chris , Australia
Sydney Hotel CBD
7.7 Very good
Based on 570 reviews

Hotel location is very good, walking distance to Sydney town tourist spot, such as Sydney tower, St mary's cathedral sydney, Chinatown, Paddy's market, Darling harbour side, and Town hall MRT station and so on.

.. Cleanliness of hotel room is 10/10 provide daily room cleanning sevices... The room interior design is comfortable and look like new... provide mini frige, hair dryer, TV... if u booking for 3 people as me then got a queen bed and a single bed then the single bed have own TV, this is what i am surprising... The hotel staff is nice and willing to provide useful information... Only the thing no convenience is no Wifi/need to pay money... but most of hotel in sydney are same... Environment of hotel, u can find the restaurant around this hotel easily...

Show more
KOK , Malaysia
Megaboom City Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 405 reviews

We left the room at roughly 7pm and got back at 2am. When we went for a shower before bed we noticed that all the towles was moving.

I left my towle on the hook next to the wall when we left but it has been hang on the rack when we got back. The bed decoration was put back to where it was (we left it on the floor when we left). The room was not tudy up. As it was too late we only brought it to the receptionist when we checked out. The receptionist asked if there was anything missing and we told her no, we only concerned about our security and our privity. She quicklytold us that she has viewed the CCTV footage and there was no one entered the room. When we asked to view the CCTV footage she said "So far everything is under investigation but there was nothing missing from your room". We told her it was not the point we were concerned about our security and privacy , however, she just simply dismissed us. We were not happy with the answer from the hotel and we will not recommended it.

Show more
Craig , Australia
Primus Hotel Sydney
9 Excellent
Based on 147 reviews

Really bad joined up service. I arrived and all was looking great but the service handovers really let this hotel down.

I check-in and upgraded to an all inclusive breakfast package and they told me my room was having it's TV fixed. Not a problem, I'll drop off my bags, go to work and all will be good when I get back late after a conference. I arrive and find the TV is broken. Service guide in room says in-room menu is located on TV. I go down to reception and they say things have changed and there is a new in-room menu somewhere in my room. I find menu and try to order and my phone does not work! In the morning I come downstairs to find breakfast team telling me I've not upgraded my package to include breakfast. I eat from one of the worst breakfast spreads I've come across in a long time and then when I check out the reception team tell me I have two breakfast charged on my room. This place came highly recommended but there is no way I will be staying here again considering I paid over $400 for 1 night here it is charging 5* prices for 3* service. Not good.

Show more
Christopher , United Kingdom
The Sydney Boulevard Hotel
8.1 Excellent
Based on 1301 reviews

Booked the twin room as hoped a friend would be able to use the other bed but ended up on my own.The room was huge with two queen size beds, and on the seventh floor was quiet and peaceful.

I had some technology issues, wasted a few hours on Friday evening trying to get the free wi-fi to work, like most Sydney hotels it doesn't. Also the TV remote had some issues, was very difficult to change channels and twice I could not turn the TV off so had to do it from the wall. May have needed new batteries, but the TV was also small and basic. It was also a shame that there was not one room ready for me to check into, so I could change and freshen up, before check in time, but apparently the hotel was full, and I was offered the facilities of the gym on the 24th floor so I guess that was fair enough. The room itself was more than adequate, it was convenient for the Art Gallery where I wanted to be, and I was able to get the airport shuttle in the morning. If you just want a good and convenient room and not worried about the trimmings such as wi-fi and TV, this is the place.

Show more
Lesley , United Kingdom
Fraser Suites Sydney
8.5 Excellent
Based on 653 reviews

We've on only stayed few days, but what I love the most about the place is the staff more attentive and very polite and very welcoming.

..the only problem during my stayed is when I have to check out on the next day, I saw a parking notice letter on top off my car, they've missed to communicate about the free parking that we should have out there is for free,,but the problem have resolve very quickly...the room it's quite nice had a big bed,but small space for my liking...the room was too much dusty when I arrive the phone wasn't working and I am not very happy about that because I couldn't make a call...Now I am very eratate about the dust in that room..no bath tub...only shower...now I've stayed with one off the hotel in the past in CBD...I thought it was more standout than this, and big spaces. Had a bath tub and big shower for less money that I've payed for this one...I thought renting an apartment would make the difference cause it would be a bit bigger than this...but come to think of it,,it dint make a lot off difference really this place it's more smaller than I thought...considering it's a service apartment I would not rate this place a high score...towel for this place it's poor,,they only leave you two towel..so one towel a day...normally they should leave two towel per reserve...but this one no,,, I don't like my stayed at this apartment...bad experience...I won't go back and stay in this place again.!

Show more
Marivic , Australia
Sir Stamford At Circular Quay Hotel
8.9 Excellent
Based on 466 reviews

My partner and I had a delightful evening at the Sir Stamford. We chose it for its easy access to Circular Quay and Sydney Harbour as we had a family function in the City to attend.

I was impressed with the sumptuous decor and couldn't wait to get back to enjoy the welcoming fire in the lobby lounge. We didn't get a chance to eat in the restaurant but the bar was a lovely spot to catch up with a glass of sparkling wine. We found the staff's warmth and friendly attention a refreshing change after recent stays elsewhere. Our room was lovely! The Juliet balcony overlooking the park was so pretty. The room was gorgeous and had everything we needed - in fact we were loathe to leave and tried to stay an extra night - sadly it is too popular and we had to relocate! Loved the bath!

Show more
Diana , Australia
Novotel Sydney on Darling Harbour Hotel
8 Very good
Based on 661 reviews

This Novotel property is quite old and it is showing its age. It is in the process of upgrading. So my comment might be a bit premature.

I was put into Room 301 for the first night and it must have been adjacent to a machinery room. There is a constant low frequency drumming that sounded like it is from a disco. I tried to tolerate it but ear plugs and even noise cancelling earphones did not help. Did not sleep but as it was late, did not want to create any unnecessary problems. Room was changed the following morning but the front office staff was not interested to know the reason for the change. So much for customer service. I think they should not put anybody into that room until they fix the problem. That floor was designated for United and Cathay Pacific airline staff so maybe most of them are just too tired to notice. Breakfast was below average and if you need to pay extra for it, go somewhere else. There are a lot of cafes at the waterfront that serve breakfast. You are better off there. All in all, this is one of the poorer Novotel that I have stayed. At the rate that they charge, they should have better deliverables.

Show more
Joaquim , Singapore
Mercure Sydney Hotel
8 Very good
Based on 1136 reviews

I was hosting a group for the evening (two people in the group I had never met before). I made the decision to dine at the hotel because it was convenient for everyone and we only had that evening to spend together.

I regretted the decision from the moment we ordered cocktails at the bar. The beer was warm and the service was stagnant. Our second round of drinks was repeated incorrectly......... one of our group found a fly in their beer. When the staff was notified they acknowledged but did nothing else. I should have followed my gut then and cancelled our dinner reservation......I did not do that only because we were short on time. Here's how dinner went: We were the third table to be seated but it took 15 minutes to get a menu and then another 25 minutes for someone to take our order. When the food finally came the plates did not come out together making it very awkward to start the meal. The steak was cold! How can you serve a cold steak? The Kangaroo was too tough to chew. The salads were a lousy bowl of chopped iceberg lettuce. Insulting! As I was hosting the meal and had chosen to dine with you I was extremely embarrassed and am still apologizing to my colleagues. This was their one and only night in Sydney. I am from California and had much higher expectations of Sydney cuisine. The manager did comp the Kangaroo which I do appreciate but it was too late and this did not make up for the extreme disappointment and the embarssment of our only dining experience in Sydney. There are lots of food options though and you can get delicious and sumptous meals in Chinatown. The hotel don't offer complimentary bottled water. The hotel and our rooms were clean and housekeeping provided. Our room had 2 bathrooms which was a great bonus for a family of 5. There were 3 lifts so not waiting for long. We were given a very early check in, which we appreciated and paid $20 for a late check out, which was awesome too. Another plus for us was that with our room facing inwards, yes it meant view of building but it also meant next to no street noise for a sound sleep on the comfy beds. After a long drive from Brisbane it was a great relief to finally arrive at the Q Station, North Head, Manly first impressions were great.

You are greeted by wonderful views out over Sydney Harbour, in the distance you can quite clearly see the tall buildings of the Sydney CBD. After accessing the gates to the complex, you follow a long drive down to the reception area of the hotel, an old but wonderfully restored building that was obviously the centre of operations during the the Q Stations hey day. It didn't take long to finalise the check in process and make our way to our room, the only drawback here was the walk from where you park your car to your room with your bags, being a conservation area, vehicles are restricted to certain areas only. Upon entering our room, we were greeted by two neatly furnished rooms, one for the bed, the other with a lounge and t.v. and, although I was aware that the room didn't come with an en suite, (Wife didn't) it was just a few short steps to your own toilet and bathroom/shower, not too much of an inconvenience I thought. At the rear of your set of rooms, was a long veranda which overlooked Sydney harbour and the approaches to the Manly ferry terminus, lovely views. We had three nights at the Q Station, North Head, breakfast was included and was an exceptional spread, although the same food was on offer for all three mornings, I particularly liked it as it had all the usual favourites, sausage, egg, bacon, mushrooms etc. We enjoyed our stay at the Q Station but unfortunately there was one disapointing night during our stay, Thursday and Friday were fine but, on the Saturday night, the complex had a wedding reception to the left of us and a 50th birthday party to the right, the noise this night was unbearable, especially when we had to be up early the next morning for our drive back to Brisbane. Having spent dizzying hours trying to find a base for a three-day stay in Sydney with my 12-yr-old son, I came across The Admiral Collingwood Lodge.

It sounded promising. It more than delivered on that promise. We weren't looking for nightlife or fancy restaurants and didn't want too much city bustle, so this Lodge's location just up the river was perfect. But don't think it is way out in the middle of suburban nowhere - the ferry ride into Circular Quay takes a mere 20 minutes or so (though it can be so spectacular, you may wish it took longer!) and the wharf is a 5 to 8 minute stroll away. There are also buses running into town from just up the road. We took one that went directly to Bondi Beach, giving us a free 'city tour' as it went! There are several pretty good restaurants in the vicinity. We had several take-aways, which we ate in the well-equipped kitchen/dining area that is available for guests to use. The couple who run the place are extremely helpful and full of information and chat about the local area, the city and their interesting lives. Rob is certainly well on his way to Respected Elder-hood! All in all a fantastic place to stay, but this enthusiastic review comes with just one reservation: the lodge won't be to everyone's taste. The building is a beautiful old house, tastefully converted into rooms, but with shared bathrooms. The atmosphere is one of refined, arty elegance - it's the kind of place you'd see in magazines - and as such it is not for anyone wanting to party or be generally loud and raucous!

The quality of service was guaranteed the moment we walked into the entrance of Randwick Central Suites.

The customer service representative went through the necessary paperwork seamlessly and amicably explained to us the whereabouts of our room. When we stepped inside the room, it was spotless, comfortable and very clean. We carefully looked around to see if there were any spiderwebs or insects, and there was none for the entire duration of our stay. The bathroom was very clean, and the shower was functional. The kitchenette contained a sufficient amount of cutlery and crockery to ensure maximum comfort for our trip. Tea, coffee, washing detergent, laundry powder, and shower essentials were provided as well. There was a functional fridge, microwave and oven. The bed's mattress was of high quality and it wasn't too soft - it was firm enough to ensure no back pain. The room even had a little balcony area - and a rack for us to dry some clothes on! And the amount of powerpoints! There were many powerpoints to allow us to charge our devices - I think there were about 6 in total, which is amazing! The location could not have been any better. Randwick Central Suites is located right next door to Randwick Shopping Centre, which is situated near a multitude of cafes and eateries, and it's also a 5-10 minute walk away from Randwick Ritz and The Spot. This hotel is definitely of premium quality - it was both comfortable like a home and luxurious like a hotel.

More about Sydney

As the capital of New South Wales, Sydney is the largest and most cosmopolitan city of Australia. Several large metropolitan areas and a wide network of trains and buses cater to the city. Sydney Airport is the gateway for the majority of visitors, and Green Square station can be used to access the city.

The city of Sydney is host to many famous landmarks, none more so than the iconic Sydney Opera House. The opera house as well as the Sydney Harbour Bridge are both situated on Circular Quay, a hub of activity and the location of the city’s ferry terminal. Beaches are also a popular draw, including the likes of Bondi Beach. Bondi’s Campbell Parade is a busy area both day and night, and shops, cafes, and bars line the beachfront.

Shopping areas of the city are readily available. Exclusive boutiques can be spotted on Oxford Street in Paddington, and Pitt Street is home to the luxury brands and department stores. Sydney is also very pedestrian friendly. The city’s friendly weather and wide footpaths encourage exploration of the city, and with all it has to offer, visitors find it hard to decline.

Be sure to check out the interactive map of Sydney for information on hotel locations, attractions, and must-see destinations.

It is on the fringe of the CBD. Only 5 to 10 minute walk to Rocks, Darling harbour and circle quay We were booked into a club level room entitling you to canopies and drinks from 5:30 to 7:30pm. Quality of bites was excellent and menu changes daily. We also had access to breakfast on club level but opted for larger and more diverse offerings in 1st floor restaurant. We found ingredients, especially seasonally fruits to be excellent! Hotel does have indoor swimming pool but is on the smallish side Staff was capable, engaging and quite helpful. Learned best way to get to the airport from hotel is by train. We did have a top floor view over the harbour but a number of rooms are more obstructed so please be sure to inquire about the view. All and all, one of the best experiences we've had in hotels for quite some time. Would not hesitate to strongly recommend! Show more steven , United States Shangri-la Hotel 8.7 Excellent Based on 1499 reviews Get a room with a view of the Opera House, especially during the Vivid Festival! On the down side, the wonderful view from the bar on level 36 is spoiled by lack of access. The table layout is poor, and people book the space for functions, leaving it inaccessible for hotel guests. I had stayed here previously, so asked at check-in if I could reserve a table along the north facing window side, and was told it wasn't necessary, just show up close to opening time. The bar opens at 17.00, and I was there at 16.50, and there were three couples ahead of me waiting. With the tables already reserved, and four people ahead of me, I missed out. The entire north-east corner was reserved for a function, so that remained empty, and so the view was essentially quarantined. It could be managed so much more efficiently with better skills and communication. Show more robert , Australia Radisson Blu Hotel Sydney 8.9 Excellent Based on 472 reviews We loved our stay here! The location is very convenient as it is just a few minutes from Circular Quay, George Street (shopping area), Train and etc. The staff is also very kind and helpful. Several large metropolitan areas and a wide network of trains and buses cater to the city. Sydney Airport is the gateway for the majority of visitors, and Green Square station can be used to access the city. The city of Sydney is host to many famous landmarks, none more so than the iconic Sydney Opera House . The opera house as well as the Sydney Harbour Bridge are both situated on Circular Quay , a hub of activity and the location of the city’s ferry terminal. Beaches are also a popular draw, including the likes of Bondi Beach. Bondi’s Campbell Parade is a busy area both day and night, and shops, cafes, and bars line the beachfront. Shopping areas of the city are readily available. Exclusive boutiques can be spotted on Oxford Street in Paddington, and Pitt Street is home to the luxury brands and department stores. Sydney is also very pedestrian friendly. The city’s friendly weather and wide footpaths encourage exploration of the city, and with all it has to offer, visitors find it hard to decline.
